conversion_verification.notes: The model successfully establishes a 3D isometric cutaway with clear verticality and volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D geometry; wall thickness and floor planes are well-defined. Minor perspective compression on the back wall.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Significant layout alterations. Bed 4 and Bed 3 rooms have been merged or replaced with a living area not present in the 2D plan. The balcony area has been enclosed.

interior_elements.notes: Furniture is present but often 'stuck' to walls as vertical relief rather than floor-standing objects. Bed placements are mirrored or rotated compared to the plan.

visual_clarity.notes: High rendering quality with good lighting. Loss of points for 'ghosting' of beds into wall textures.

detected_errors.description: The right wing of the house (Bed 3 and 4) has been completely remodeled into a single room with a sofa, violating the original room configuration.
Balcony area is rendered as a sunken interior room rather than an outdoor space.
Beds are rendered as relief patterns on the walls rather than 3D floor models.

summary: A visually impressive 3D render that correctly establishes architectural volume but takes significant creative liberties with the floor plan layout.
